    Transforming Covariates

    2017-11-14

    Supported transformations

    For convenience, you may wish to transform one or more of your covariates within the model estimation call. For example, imagine we want to natural log transform the variable dist in a linear regression:

    cars <- transform(cars, dist.log = log(dist))
    

    m.log <- lm(speed ~ log(dist), data = cars)
    

    m.log2 <- lm(speed ~ dist.log, data = cars)

    Then we want to find quantities of interest when the dist variable is 26 to 56 (the first to third quartile):

    
library(smargins)
    

    

    
summary(smargins(m.log, at = list(dist = c(26, 56))))
    ##   dist     mean        sd   median lower_2.5 upper_97.5
## 1   26 13.85300 0.4557681 13.84481  12.99640   14.73241
## 2   56 18.15864 0.5170302 18.16852  17.09482   19.14123

    We could also estimate the model with dist as a polynomial. For example:

    # Find range of polynomial values
    

    

    m2 <- lm(speed ~ poly(dist, 2), data = cars)
    

    
summary(smargins(m2, at = list(dist = with(cars, seq(min(dist), max(dist), 10)))))
    ##    dist     mean        sd   median lower_2.5 upper_97.5
## 1     2 12.83575 0.5047519 12.83432  11.79639   13.81809
## 2    12 13.53386 0.4551315 13.51764  12.67495   14.43888
## 3    22 14.16275 0.4321224 14.15910  13.37449   14.98658
## 4    32 14.72241 0.4259579 14.70511  13.92321   15.55500
## 5    42 15.21285 0.4269057 15.20426  14.41516   16.04485
## 6    52 15.63407 0.4280064 15.61813  14.82609   16.48623
## 7    62 15.98607 0.4258642 15.96438  15.18144   16.84109
## 8    72 16.26884 0.4206187 16.24995  15.48382   17.11550
## 9    82 16.48239 0.4160413 16.46037  15.73455   17.32397
## 10   92 16.62672 0.4197078 16.61296  15.87221   17.46989
## 11  102 16.70183 0.4421072 16.69549  15.88777   17.55446
## 12  112 16.70772 0.4933669 16.69972  15.80633   17.70138

    Splines and other transformations should generally work as expected.

    
library(splines)
    

    

    m3 <- lm(speed ~ bs(dist, df = 4), data = cars)
    

    
summary(smargins(m3, at = list(dist = with(cars, seq(min(dist), max(dist), 10)))))
    ##    dist      mean        sd    median  lower_2.5 upper_97.5
## 1     2  4.722334 2.0528058  4.605462  0.6299533   8.910425
## 2    12  7.317212 1.0306186  7.310995  5.3591282   9.574105
## 3    22 10.105871 0.6674817 10.096605  8.8394911  11.479704
## 4    32 12.881258 0.5256951 12.886005 11.8755309  13.901020
## 5    42 15.436317 0.5943892 15.443722 14.2537869  16.626393
## 6    52 17.563995 0.7401271 17.574373 16.1694459  19.081354
## 7    62 19.068342 0.7404948 19.045245 17.5530967  20.528729
## 8    72 20.008800 0.8804635 20.032236 18.3416809  21.660791
## 9    82 20.700207 1.2470230 20.700223 18.1773423  23.096920
## 10   92 21.468502 1.4562345 21.437950 18.4751916  24.299035
## 11  102 22.639625 1.5740702 22.676633 19.5043837  25.660947
## 12  112 24.539517 2.8520670 24.630680 18.9796464  30.123308
